greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of divisors d of n! with k prime factors (counting multiplicity), such that both d and n!/d have distinct prime multiplicities.
comment: A number has distinct prime multiplicities iff its prime signature is strict.
example: Row n = 8 counts the following divisors (empty columns shown as dots):
xref: A022559 gives row lengths minus one.
A336500 is the generalization to all positive integers.
A336868 gives the first (also last) column.
A336870 is the version for superprimorials.
A130091 lists numbers with distinct prime multiplicities.
A181796 counts divisors with distinct prime multiplicities.
A327498 gives the maximum divisor of n with distinct prime multiplicities.
A336414 counts divisors of factorials with distinct prime multiplicities.
A336415 counts divisors of factorials with equal prime multiplicities.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 08 2020
